newsitem.title: USA: U.S. West spot power firm on heat, flat BPA prices.
newsitem.headline: U.S. West spot power firm on heat, flat BPA prices.

text.p: U.S. West spot electricity prices were steady Friday on forecasts of a heatwave through next week and Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) keeping its next-day power prices steady, market sources said.
The latest six- to 10-day forecasts showed temperatures in the western U.S. to be above normal to much-above normal.
BPA reportedly held the value of electricity in 17-18 hour blocks for Saturday and Sunday delivery at $23.00 per megawatt hour (MWh), unchanged from Thursday's prices for Friday.
But the federal power marketing agency lowered 16-hour blocks for delivery Monday at $21.00.
